newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIAN BANCOREX BANK LIFTS TERM DEPOSIT RATES.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIAN BANCOREX BANK LIFTS TERM DEPOSIT RATES.

text.p: Romanian state-run bank Banca Romana de Comert Exterior Bancorex SA will raise rates on leu deposits in line with an upward trend of interest rates following tightened monetary policies.
From Tuesday, the bank's rates on one- and two-month deposits will rise by five percentage points to an annual 65 percent, a Bancorex statement said on Monday.
It said three-month rates would rise 10 points to 65 percent a year. The bank will pay an annual 67 percent on six-month, nine-month and one-year deposits, up from 55 percent.
This month, the central bank (BNR) raised key rates to temper inflation and restore confidence in the leu currency, which has fallen about 40 percent against the dollar from January 1.
The BNR's one-week rate climbed to 70 percent from 53 percent earlier this month, when the bank also lifted the discount rate to 50 percent from 35 percent.
Year-on-year inflation surged to 56.9 percent last year from 27.8 percent in 1995, nearly triple the 20-percent target agreed upon with the International Monetary Fund.
